Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on Youtube video] There is nothing wrong, nor will there ever be wrong with any Sabre printers. Case closed. [phone rings, Michael picks it up] Michael Scott, as seen on TV.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: [high-pitched voice] I saw you on the news and I want to pinch your tiny wiener... [normal voice] It's Packer!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OH! Pack Man, I thought you were a girl!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Apparently, there are allegations that Sabre printers can cause a fire. So they asked me to give a statement to the press. I'm like, what? All right. So I do it. It's on TV last night. And it's in the paper today. And it's online. And then I call Froggy 98.7, the request line. I talk to the host about it on the air. It's like, come on, people, enough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, we are at DEFCON 5. I am officially the second-most watched clip of the day on the WBRE news site.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's number one?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that teacher who was wrongfully accused of being a pedophile. Now, we cannot let the pedophile win again! I would like you all to go to the website and watch my clip eleven times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So instead of working, you want...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Come on! Get it up! That's what... let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, did you see this report that the zoo got a baby otter? It's on the same site!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Awww, it's kissing its mommy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, you have to see, this is like, the cutest thing ever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? A baby otter? Okay, um, count me in as who cares. It's not even that interesting a baby otter, it can't even stand up. [looks toward computer] It's trying to stand up... [choking up] there it goes.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Howdy. I hope I'm not interrupting anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jo! We were not expecting you!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: 'Course you all, no doubt, know why I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Turns out our printers are famous. They're all over the news. It's an interesting story. Cheap foreign printers attacking innocent Americans. Well, actually the, the real story isn't quite as racy, but uh... let's give it a go.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jo, I think that I know what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I'm not sure you do, teddy bear.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, now I think I might not.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Not long ago, we discovered a defect in one of our printers, so we got a software patch and fixed it right up, just like that. I don't know how it works. But just as we were about to send out a letter to our affected customers, giving 'em free toner, and we keep 'em, happy, but somebody here, they liked that first story better. The one where we lose half our clients for no damn good reason! Whoever it was who talked to the press, they should come forward, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jo, Jo, I can assure you it was no one in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Can you now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Absolutely. Anyone who talked to the press, please raise your hand.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [quietly, to Andy] Put your hand up, Norma Rae.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If you say anything, so help me God, I'll break off the temples of your glasses and stick them in your eye sockets.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So unfair. Even if I thought that our printers killed baby seals, I would not be a whistleblower. The Bernards, for generations, have silenced whistleblowers. It's how we made all our money. Woody Guthrie wrote a song about us. [sings] Old Mr. Bernard, old Mr. Bernard, who have you silenced today?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [as Gabe hands out forms to everyone] It's a little form, says "I did not do it."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is no reason for anyone here to sign this, because I know everything there is to know about these people. I know when their birthdays are, I know what their favorite kind of cake is, I know what color streamers they like...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: All that's just birthday information, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, but it shows a bigger picture.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Why don't you come with me? We'll start out with the honcho, what'cha say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: When Mama was working as a prison guard and something went missing, she'd ask one question:

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: So say we catch this whistleblower, what do you think I should do with him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should give him a one-way ticket to Montego Bay, where they keep all the al-Qaeda.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Uh, that's, uh, Guantanamo Bay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. You put them in jail for a long time, you put them in jail for as long as you can.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, I guess we're all right, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want these people to really pay, I want them to suffer. I'd prefer it if they died, 'cause it's not right.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, IT guy.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Mind if I get in there for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, sure thing, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Just one... [Dwight pushes Nick's neck to the desk and pushes his arm up] Gah! Ah! Dwight, what the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Apache persuasion hold, that's the hell! What are you doing to my computer?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The lawyers are searching our hard drives for information on the leak. Thanks a lot, Big Brother.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're with Big Brother? Okay, go ahead. I got nothing to hide.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, are they searching all our computers?

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Kevin runs to his desk] I already got to yours, Kevin. [Kevin runs back]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, that's cool. Sometimes... sometimes I run. I'm a runner.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Everybody knows it was Andy, and it is not fair for us all to take the fall for his big stupid mouth!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ridiculous, Angela. And like I'm going to believe one of his spermed lovers.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Look, he's been complaining about this for a while, it's not crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hold that thought. I don't want to waste your time, and I wouldn't dare waste mine. I didn't do it. Now, I don't know exactly who did it, but I have a list right here... [hands Jo a piece of paper] You should fire the following people.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, I'm inclined to believe you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why would I disparage a company that has made me rich beyond my wildest dreams?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah, I noticed you've had a great year. Good boy... you turning that money into more money?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you referring to alchemy?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I don't like to tell a man what to do with his money, but if you ain't investing in property, then you're dumber than a dummy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not dumb. I'm smart.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, buy property. That's my advice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is there something that you would like to say to me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: About talking to the press?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I, I didn't know. I didn't do that!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay? I, I... didn't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't believe you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I swear on the graves of my parents who aren't even dead yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a little much. All right, all right, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't care, that's how much I swear!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I believe you, I believe you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know who's giving Darryl any crap. He was more bothered about it than me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you tell anyone outside of this office that the printers were catching on fire?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I did. I, I was talking to this girl at a bar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I think she could... sense my sadness, and I, and I found out too late that she... she's the copy editor at the Trib.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my god. Was she cute?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, god, Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I basically swore up and down that none of my employees did it, and then I find out that one of my best ones did. And now he's probably going to get fired for it. And if that is not poetic justice, I don't know what is.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Sounds like you were as blindsided by this as I was.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, that's...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: And we didn't find anything on your computer.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Except this. [hands stack of paper to Toby]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, this is, uh, just a mystery novel that I've been working on.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I know what it is. I skimmed the first chapter. I'm just curious, why would a man who hates people want to have a relationship with a maid?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, I don't know, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: The way I look at it, there's only one of two reasons. He knows a secret about her that she doesn't know herself, or he wants to use her services to mop up after a murder.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh... yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Write your own damn novel.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was you? You were the leak?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. I'm talking to this woman at daycare...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's telling me about all her amazing trip to Vietnam, I have nothing. I tell her our printers catch on fire, spontaneously!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why'd you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Her husband's a reporter.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So now everyone hates Andy, and it's this whole mess, and I don't know what to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, just relax. Just need to relax.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I could tell Jo... or I could tell Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is a very good idea. This is good. Let's get all the bad ideas out now. Flush them out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You leaked it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know what to do! Do I go tell Jo, or - I don't want everyone to keep blaming the wrong person!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know what the best plan is, Pam. Oh god... my mind is going a mile an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That fast?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Two whistleblowers... two! I always thought Darryl and Pam might get me fired for something I said.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael knocks on Pam's desk] Yeah? [Michael points at Pam, himself, and Meredith, mimes drinking, driving, then points to his watch and holds up five fingers] I weirdly know exactly what you're saying to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So see you in Meredith's van in five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, you didn't need to actually say it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in Meredith's van] I have never seen so many parking tickets.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right, this is just messed up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you know what's messed up? This situation all up in here is what's messed up! We need to brainstorm, we need to get out of this! Brain hurricane. Come on, think.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do we got?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [opening door] Hey guys, sorry I'm late.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're not going for yogurt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's okay, she's cool, she also whistle-blew.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Guys, I couldn't help it, it is so boring where we work. I mean, it's as interesting as a morgue. It might be less interesting than a morgue.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, it's as interesting as a morgue.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Of course I'm the leak! I think I Tweeted it! I can't control what I say to people, I spend the whole day talking! I mean, I video chat, I Skype, I text, I Tweet, I phone, I Woof...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Woof is a site that I'm launching to be the last word in social networking. For just $12.99 a month, Woof links up all your communication portals so you are always within reach. It's part of the dog pack, as I call it. But, look, why tell you when I can show you. [types on his phone] I just sent myself a Woof. [fax machine makes noise, several windows pop up on computer behind Ryan with accompanying sounds, including barking]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [on phone] Ryan, you have a Woof on line 1.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thank you, Erin. Woof!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here's what we do. I say we just smash all the computers. We destroy the evidence. No evidence, no case.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wouldn't we get fired for smashing all the computers?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Okay, not all the computers, just our computers.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That idea sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just don't say no.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Michael, you know you don't have to turn us all in. All you need is one scapegoat.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Uh, if you turn me in, I'm turning in Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's just what we need, another black man in prison. You know, let's just...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nobody's going to prison, okay? Um... all right, Michael, you need to convince Jo to go easy on us. And then we'll all confess once we know our jobs are safe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You can count on me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sees Toby banging on the vending machine] Let me give you a hand.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready? [they pull the vending machine towards them; Dwight's phone rings] Got it? Oh shoot. Got it? [walks away, opens phone] Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Realtor
Quote.Text: [on phone] The property you're looking at is in great shape. By the way, it has a very spacious basement office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Basement office? You mean like a lair?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Jo.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was thinking about our little leak problem. I was up all lunch thinking about what we should do to this individual. You know what I think we should do? We make 'em come to work, and we work 'em, and we make 'em sit next to all the people they screwed over. And, and we pay 'em but we make 'em feel like they did something really wrong. The one question I have is, do we give them a Christmas bonus? I say yes, it's Christmas, but right after they're back in the thick of it.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Michael Scott... what do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It doesn't matter what I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: If it doesn't matter, then tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Because I want to deal with it the way I deal with it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, deal with this. [crosses arms]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Empathize with me for a moment. I came up here with a big problem, and now I got a branch manager who's giving me the silent treatment... Speak to me... speak. [Jo's dog barks] Come with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [as Michael and Jo leave] Are you leaving? Oh, am I... should I continue with the investigation?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you going to kill me?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hahahahahaha.

Quote.Speaker: Realtor
Quote.Text: [on phone] I just need you to come by later and sign a few forms.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Realtor
Quote.Text: What time works for you? [Dwight looks across the street] Mr. Schrute, what time works?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cancel it. I want you to make an offer at seventeen twenty-five Slough Avenue. Make 'em an offer they can't refuse. No, on second thought, low ball them. Don't call me 'til you have it.

Quote.Speaker: Realtor
Quote.Text: But... [Dwight closes phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on Jo's jet] Are we going some place far away? I know you said no questions, but... I have an early dinner that I need to get to... with the Chief of Police.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm very relieved to learn it wasn't you.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: All right. Uh, Stan, you're up.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What a rich timbre your voice has. Okay, I am prepared to conclude the investigation. And... you did it. [nods at Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? Based on what?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh, just all the evidence. And it really seems like it was you. Can we all agree to say that it was Andy for now, and sit with it, see how it feels?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right. Sounds good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Guys, I think that seems a little unfair. I mean, I feel like we don't definitely know it was Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know, I mean, for all we know it could have been... Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have rights.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Let's just talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not going to tell you anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Honey, you don't seem like your normal self.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm going through a little bit of a rough patch.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Mama Jo knew there was something up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whole year, actually. My favorite restaurant closed down.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, I hate that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And my new favorite restaurant sucks... I bought a video camera last year, and I was looking at the tapes, and there were only like twelve minutes that I felt was worth taping the whole year. And most of that was just birds in my condo complex. What is that? ... I miss Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Who's Holly?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly Flax from the Nashua branch. Best HR rep that Dunder Mifflin has ever seen. It's not been a blockbuster year for me financially. My Blockbuster stock is down.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, I think that the real question is:

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I may have heard from an old client, and I may have immediately started spreading the news to other clients and potential clients, yeah. But I'm not here to talk about that. I am here to talk about Suck It. Suck it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gabe, I told you all about the printers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, it could be you, Gabe. I mean, that's the point.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, it's totally obvious.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I think we all can agree that it's either Gabe or Angela. [flips a coin] It's Angela. Get her, boys.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Hey guys, uh, sorry to interrupt. I just wanted to say goodbye to everyone. Through Teach for America, I'm going to go down to Detroit and teach, uh, inner city kids about computers.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh, not now.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, it's just that my friends are in the car waiting, so I thought I would...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [quietly] Phyllis, what's this guy's name again?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't know, is it Shadow or Garth, it's something weird, I...

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: My name is Nick.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, well, Nick, we're in a meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Okay, look, I get it, people. I'm the lame IT guy, and everybody hates me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, listen man, you can't take it personally.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: You called me man? I just said my name just now, did you forget it already?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No... sport.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: You, you guys have fifteen parties a week, you can't learn my name?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey, hey IT guy. Here's the story, champ. None of us have spent a lot of time getting to know you, okay? We liked the last guy, Siddiq, because he kept to himself, and we also thought he might have been a terrorist. You know what, I'm going to leave you with one other thought. Inner city kids use computers for two things, games and porn. So good luck wasting your life, lurch.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Thank you so much for that. I saw all your hard drives, and guess what? [gestures to Ryan] You're not a photographer. [gestures to Kelly] And you definitely can't fit into a size two. Darryl, man, you're on Facebook. Why you been telling people you're not on Facebook? People want to be your friend, man! All right? And you. [points to Andy] This guy, you're the one who told the press. You wrote an e-mail to the editor. I saw it, and I also saw a QuickTime movie of your little printer fire test on your hard drive. This guy's the snitch, he's the snitch. So that's it, check it out. [gives the finger]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're going to believe that guy?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: When I was growing up, there was nothing better than being a big old business tycoon. And I thought I'd break that glass ceiling and be a hero to all those little girls out there... and they'd make a Barbie out of me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm, hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I, did I sell cheap printers? I do. But if I have to go out there in front of the press and make one of them public apology recalls, I mean, it's all I'll ever be remembered for. Nobody will want to play with my Barbie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I would be willing, under the right circumstances, to do that for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh honey, surely you don't want that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, I surely do, and don't call me honey. [Jo laughs] You were playing too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm about to buy this building, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: You don't say? I own a one-eighth share in a rental property down in Pittston.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I'm one-eighths proud of you... enjoy that chair for now... 'cause pretty soon, you will be on your feet, at Buckingham Palace.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Phyllis, have you seen my bag?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [points to the ceiling] You deserve it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Look, I didn't want houses and schools to burn down, and children to die. Does that make me a hero? I...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [offscreen] No, it does not!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it doesn't make me the worst guy in the world, either.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It does!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I wanted to say that I think it was very brave of you to go to the press.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, thanks. Yeah, you know, just seemed like the right thing to do.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to press] We at Sabre have betrayed the trust that we have built with our customers. We regret our slow response and our lapse in candor and judgment. At this time, we are issuing a full recall of all Sabre GH400 printers. We will not rest until this problem is solved. There will be no questions. Are there any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hey, I appreciate you reading that statement. You looked pretty up there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I hope your rough patch ends soon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks. Today helped.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, give me a shout if I can brighten your life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Hey, you could transfer Holly back from Nashua.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Let me see what I can do.
